item.title: The Dubai Chamber has announced the launch of the Dubai Smartpreneur Competition for 2017
item.description: The Dubai Chamber of Commerce and Industry, working with the Smart Dubai Office, launched the second annual Dubai Smartpreneur Competition. This aligns with the vision of His Highness Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, UAE Vice President and Prime Minister, and Ruler of Dubai, to make Dubai a leading smart city. Source: Dubai Chamber. The event featured a panel discussion about the UAE government’s progress on smart city and innovation initiatives, and what will drive future sustainable growth.

item.title: Entrepreneurs in South Malaysia are receiving support from BAHTERA
item.description: The Malaysian Ministry of Finance (MoF) has revealed that the upcoming BAHTERA series will be held on October 14th and 15th at the PERSADA Convention Centre in Johor Bahru. BAHTERA aligns with the Malaysian government’s 11th Malaysia Plan to strengthen the Bumiputera economy. The event aims to equip Bumiputera entrepreneurs with valuable business insights, effective branding techniques, and relevant technology. This year, BAHTERA anticipates over 6,000 attendees. Themed Bumipreneurs of Tomorrow, BAHTERA (Southern Edition) is tailored for entrepreneurs and Bumiputera businesses in Southern Malaysia.

item.title: Success in business relies on establishing a broad network, having a strong passion, dedicating time, and learning from numerous failures
item.description: Alex Foo, co-founder of the entrepreneur-focused psychometric profiling tool Starteur, offers three key tips for entrepreneurial success. These insights, derived from both his attendance at the Global Entrepreneurship Summit 2016 (June 22-24, USA) and his personal journey as a young entrepreneur, were shared during a Shopee University session. Foo’s trip to GES 2016 was sponsored by Shopee, the e-commerce platform by Garena. This sponsorship reflects Shopee’s commitment to nurturing the next generation of Singaporean entrepreneurs.

item.title: The Global Entrepreneurship Movement was initiated in Malaysia
item.description: Source: GEM Facebook page. The Global Entrepreneurship Movement (GEM) launched officially in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia today. This non-governmental organization (NGO) aims to create a platform for entrepreneurs from various sectors like social entrepreneurship, technology, and halal to connect. “This NGO brings together community leaders from different networks who will cultivate strong partnerships for Malaysia and our entrepreneurs," shared YBhg. Tan Sri Dr Mohd Irwan Serigar Abdullah, GEM patron and Secretary General Treasury, Ministry of Finance.

item.title: Bookmate has teamed up with StarHub for its initial launch in the Asia Pacific region
item.description: Source: Bookmate. Pictured at the December 17 launch of Bookmate in Singapore are (from left): Simon Dunlop, Bookmate Founder, Andrew Baev, Bookmate Managing Director, and Michael Sim, StarHub Lead Futurist, i3 (Innovation, Investment, Incubation). Bookmate, a social platform for reading e-books, has launched in Singapore, its initial entry point into the Southeast Asian market. The service offers subscribers unlimited reading for a fixed monthly price, drawing from a library of over half a million e-books provided by 600 publishers.

item.title: Bank Mandiri is seeking submissions for the Young Entrepreneur award 2015
item.description: Bank Mandiri, a prominent bank in Indonesia, launched its yearly competition called Mandiri Young Entrepreneur (WMM) in 2015. Kartika Wirjoatmodjo, the Director of Finance & Strategy at Bank Mandiri, stated that this competition aims to discover young individuals with entrepreneurial potential who can contribute to Indonesia’s growth. Kartika added that the competition also intends to inspire a passion for entrepreneurship and innovation among students and graduates, encouraging more young entrepreneurs to emerge.

item.title: Golden Equator Consulting assists small and medium-sized enterprises and startups in advancing towards success
item.description: Golden Equator Consulting (GE Consulting), a business consultancy firm, has established a presence in Singapore to serve small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) and startups in the region. Sharon Chong, CEO of GE Consulting, noted that these businesses need strategic and operational support to streamline their growth and focus on core business functions. GE Consulting offers comprehensive business consultancy services, covering areas such as business strategy, sales positioning, financial support, marketing, technology, human resources, and legal compliance.

item.title: Global marketing summit for Malaysian entrepreneurs hosted by INSKEN
item.description: Source: INSKEN. Firdaus delivered welcome remarks at GMS 2018. Now in its second year, the Institut Keusahawanan Negara’s (INSKEN) annual Global Marketing Summit (GMS) seeks to cultivate innovative leaders within the Malaysian entrepreneurial landscape. Malaysian Minister Datuk Seri Mohd Redzuan Yusof highlighted the ongoing emphasis on fostering the expansion of entrepreneurs and small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs), particularly those in the B40 and M40 income brackets. He stated that the Ministry of Entrepreneur Development (MED) will leverage allocated funds to execute a targeted and comprehensive entrepreneur development strategy in 2019.

item.title: The Australian government, in collaboration with Microsoft and MassChallenge, aims to enhance the local startup ecosystem
item.description: The Australian government is investing A$280,000 to bring MassChallenge, a leading global startup accelerator, to Australia. The goal is to support the growth of local startups. MassChallenge, in partnership with Microsoft Australia and the Australian government, will offer resources such as idea-pitching competitions, boot camps, and mentoring to strengthen the Australian startup ecosystem. As a non-profit, equity-free accelerator, MassChallenge provides promising startups with the opportunity to compete for millions of dollars in cash awards.

item.title: Job Forward introduces the Startup Essence referral tool for startups and small to medium enterprises (SMEs)
item.description: Source: Job Forward. Job Forward, the first online social recruitment platform in Singapore, has introduced Startup Essence. This new addition to their referral-based platform helps startups and small to medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) by allowing them to build recruitment pages that attract and engage potential employees. The company aims to create a new avenue for these businesses to connect with individuals who are a good fit for their company culture.

item.title: The Startup Capitals conference will begin on May 20th
item.description: Source: Startup Capitals’ website. Startup Capitals, a leading-edge conference inspired by the recent book of the same name by Singapore-based author and journalist Zafar Anjum, will be held on May 20th in Singapore at The POD, NLB, 100 Victoria Street. This one-day event, coinciding with the book’s official launch, will highlight the innovation and startup ecosystems of globally impactful cities. It will unite all facets of these ecosystems – entrepreneurs, business leaders, innovators, researchers, educators, government officials, and venture capitalists – under one roof.

item.title: IdeaLab gives power to startups in ASEAN
item.description: IdeaLab 2016, a focused two-day startup conference, will highlight ASEAN startup collaboration and the Malaysian startup scene. It also features the Malaysian Business Angels Network (MBAN) Summit, attracting investors globally. The organizers aim to bring together 500 top startups, investors, and corporations from the ASEAN ecosystem. Attendees can participate in various stages. The Ideation Stage features industry leaders discussing critical issues faced by startups in ASEAN. At the IdeaPad Stage, the best ASEAN startups compete before a panel of judges.

item.title: The winners of Ascendas-Singbridge Her Startup 2016 in Singapore have been announced
item.description: Source: The Ascendas-Singbridge Group. From left: Ho Kheng Lian, Venture Partner, Vectr Ventures; Natalie Loh, Vice President of Products, Vanitee; Kuik Xiao Shi, Co-Founder, Vanitee; Pocket Sun, Founding Partner of SoGal Ventures; Adrianna Tan, Founder, Wobe; Virginia Tan, Co-founder and Managing Director of Lean In China; Adeline Quek, Head of Regional Business Development, Grabtaxi; Mrs Nina Yang, Chief Operating Officer of Singbridge. The Ascendas-Singbridge Group selected two startups from Singapore to compete in the finals of the Ascendas-Singbridge Her Startup 2016 competition.

item.title: UOB discovers misunderstandings about financing options for small and medium businesses in Singapore
item.description: Source: UOB infographic. Statistics gathered from the Financing for Startups and Small Businesses Survey. A recent study by United Overseas Bank (UOB) revealed that a significant number of startups and small businesses in Singapore lack a comprehensive understanding of the alternative funding options available to them for early expansion. These businesses are also uncertain about how to effectively utilize options such as venture capital, venture debt, and debt and equity crowdfunding.

item.title: Asian venture capital investments have remained stable in the fourth quarter of 2016
item.description: Venture capital (VC) investment experienced a global decline in 2016, following a strong 2015, according to the Venture Pulse Q4 2016 report by KPMG Enterprise. Global VC investment decreased by 24% year-over-year, totaling US$127.4 billion. Despite a promising start to the year, investor confidence waned in the latter half of 2016 due to uncertainties in the market. Events like Brexit and the US presidential election furthered this uncertainty. Chia Tek Yew, Head of Financial Services Advisory at KPMG in Singapore, noted that this period of uncertainty allowed VCs to refine their portfolios, focus on high-potential deals, and guide their portfolio companies towards further growth.

item.title: Tips for achieving success with your startup
item.description: Thinking about launching a business from your great idea? Fabian Vandenreydt, a leader at Innotribe and the SWIFT Institute, who has witnessed the ups and downs of fintech startups, highlights key success factors. First, clearly define the problem you’re addressing and ensure it’s a genuine issue. Developing a fantastic product is futile without a problem to solve. Vandenreydt emphasizes that starting with a problem is crucial for success. Second, articulate a detailed solution implementation plan and understand your target market.

item.title: Collective Works and CapitaLand are teaming up to launch a new coworking space
item.description: Artist’s impression of the new coworking space at Capital Tower, Singapore. A new high-end coworking space will be launched on the 12th floor of Singapore’s Capital Tower. This joint venture between two companies will occupy 22,000 square feet and support 250 businesses. The space is adaptable and caters to a variety of businesses, from new startups to large corporations. Technological features include secure server hosting, video conferencing, internet phone services, and fiber optic broadband internet.

item.title: A new tech and innovation business club has been introduced in Singapore
item.description: SPECTRUM, a curated tech and innovation business club, has been established in Singapore. The organization, co-founded by Cheryl Lee and Shirley Crystal Chua, aims to create a globally connected ecosystem for businesses seeking to expand into Asia by providing expert advice, necessary resources, and strategic networks. SPECTRUM has partnered with Golden Equator and Mistletoe to form a collaborative network of seven strategic groups: innovators, learning institutions, executors, backers, enablers, government agencies, and ecosystem builders and partners.

item.title: Within the next five years, one-third of young Arabs intend to launch their own businesses
item.description: According to the 2016 ASDA’A Burson-Marsteller Arab Youth Survey, over one-third of young Arabs plan to launch their own businesses within the next five years. The survey indicates that young Arabs believe governments could do more to support them, such as promoting affordable lending, enhancing training and education opportunities, and reducing bureaucratic hurdles. When asked if their generation is more likely to start businesses than previous ones, 54% agreed. GCC youth were the most optimistic at 62%, compared to 54% in North Africa and 44% in the Levant.

item.title: HubSpot for Startups simplifies the onboarding process for new businesses
item.description: HubSpot, a company that provides marketing and sales technology, has launched a new program called HubSpot for Startups. This program is specifically designed to support startups that are working with accelerators, incubators, and entrepreneurial organizations. The program aims to help these small businesses gain momentum in their marketing and sales efforts by offering a substantial 90% discount on HubSpot’s products. These products include tools for customer relationship management (CRM), sales, and marketing.

item.title: JLL reports that tech startups are a significant driver of real estate demand in the APAC region
item.description: New types of office users are emerging in the form of startups, with more tech companies exploring unconventional spaces such as coworking facilities and industrial properties, according to JLL, a real estate and investment management firm. The technology sector in the Asia Pacific region has experienced significant growth, driven by mobile technology, e-commerce, and the rise of fintech. This growth has fueled demand for both traditional office spaces and business parks.

item.title: A white paper by the Dubai Chamber examines the funding landscape for startups in Dubai
item.description: Source: Dubai Chamber. Cover for the white paper. A recent report highlights the need for a simplified guide to help UAE startups navigate the funding landscape and connect with eager investors. The Dubai Chamber of Commerce and Industry, in partnership with Roland Berger, published this white paper, titled “Helping Startups Access Funding,” during the March edition of Dubai Startup Hub’s Entrepreneurship Advocacy Series. Dubai Startup Hub, the Chamber’s entrepreneurial arm, offers guidance and clarity to new businesses through various programs and workshops.

item.title: The introduction of InboxRank is brought to you by Unified Inbox
item.description: Unified Inbox has introduced InboxRank, a smart sorting tool designed to simplify communication management across various platforms such as email, social media, SMS, and instant messaging. Source: Unified Inbox. InboxRank prioritizes information by analyzing various factors related to individual user’s inbox activity. It continuously learns and adapts to user preferences over time. Key factors considered include: Communication frequency between the sender and receiver. The duration of their acquaintance (determined by the date of initial contact).

item.title: The fourth bootcamp for 1Malaysia Entrepreneurs has begun
item.description: Source: 1MET. Over 500 participants attended the 1MET bootcamps in Kota Kinabalu. The 1Malaysia Entrepreneur (1MET) program, an initiative of the National Entrepreneurship Development Office (NEDO) within the Malaysian Ministry of Finance, has initiated its fourth round of two-day entrepreneurial bootcamps. Utilizing an experiential model, these bootcamps offer a six-month mentoring and coaching opportunity for 500 chosen business concepts. The first group to benefit from this follow-up program commenced in August 2016.

item.title: Work together at a beach resort and form new relationships
item.description: While new coworking spaces and startup events are constantly emerging, forging meaningful connections with startups outside of one’s immediate location can still be challenging. Coworking Camp aims to bridge this gap with its upcoming six-week program. This program offers startups and digital nomads a chance to network and explore business opportunities with like-minded individuals in a relaxed and comfortable environment. Source: Coworking Camp website. Matthias Zeitler, Chief Coworker, highlights the program’s focus on fostering valuable connections and providing a space for rejuvenation.

item.title: HP has improved MSA Storage for small and medium-sized businesses
item.description: HP is introducing new features for its MSA Storage solutions to benefit startups, SMBs, and customers with small sites. These enhancements aim to increase competitiveness. The improved MSA 2040 Storage offers significantly faster application performance, up to 45% faster, without extra costs through firmware updates. Additionally, new MSA 2040 bundles provide cost savings of up to 45% for hybrid flash deployments. Furthermore, the introduction of Serial Attached SCSI (SAS) connectivity to the MSA 1040 Storage positions it as the most budget-friendly shared storage option from a major vendor.

item.title: Fikra Labs aims to speed up innovation in the travel and tourism industry
item.description: In February, during UAE Innovation Month, which promotes the country’s global innovation hub status and recognizes innovators, four Abu Dhabi groups are collaborating with Wamda, an entrepreneurship platform, to launch the Fikra Labs acceleration program. The partners, including the Department of Culture and Tourism – Abu Dhabi, Miral Asset Management, Etihad Aviation Group, and Abu Dhabi National Exhibitions Company (ADNEC), with support from Abu Dhabi Global Market (ADGM), aim to boost innovation and entrepreneurship in Abu Dhabi’s travel and tourism industry.

item.title: AppShack is a reality show that connects investors with startups
item.description: Source: AppShack. The official launch was officiated by Bhg. Dato’ Jailani Johari, Deputy Minister of Communications and Multimedia Malaysia. AppShack, a Malaysian company that connects startups with organizations seeking mobile application innovation, has officially launched. This platform supports startups in developing their ideas by providing mentorship, technical expertise, business structure assistance, legal advice, and financial funding opportunities. Successful applicants can connect with investors and partners, including consortiums, venture capitalists, and bankers.

item.title: 71 SG introduces international market access programs for startups based in Singapore
item.description: Singapore-based startup, 71 SG, has introduced programs designed to assist other local startups in expanding into the Chinese market. These programs are supported by International Enterprise (IE) Singapore. One such program, the Start-up Development & Learning Programme (SDL), aims to facilitate a smooth market entry for startups by connecting them with potential customers, partners, and investors. The SDL offers Singaporean startups a five-day tech and business workshop that provides access to overseas markets, market intelligence, networking opportunities, and funding prospects.

item.title: Alibaba Cloud introduces the Create@Alibaba Cloud startup program
item.description: Alibaba Cloud, the cloud computing branch of Alibaba Group, has launched its first international startup program, Create@Alibaba Cloud. The program was announced in Singapore, home to Alibaba Cloud’s international headquarters, which will also serve as the regional hub for the initiative. Singapore was selected as the regional hub due to its strong ties and access to other ASEAN markets, such as Thailand, Indonesia, and Malaysia. The company explained that Singapore’s robust connectivity and reputation as Asia’s most entrepreneurial economy enable participating startups to easily connect within Singapore and expand into neighboring markets.

item.title: Members of Impact Hub have access to resources provided by Google for Entrepreneurs
item.description: Source: Impact Hub. Horowitz (left) with Sai (right). Impact Hub, the largest coworking and entrepreneur-building community in Singapore, has partnered with Google for Entrepreneurs as its first tech hub partner in Southeast Asia. This collaboration grants Impact Hub Singapore members access to Google for Entrepreneurs’ global network and resources, encompassing numerous coworking spaces and community programs across 135 countries. Impact Hub Singapore is dedicated to fostering startup growth by offering comprehensive support, ranging from coworking space to essential resources and tools.

item.title: GoDaddy is dedicated to creating impressive and impactful business identities for small businesses
item.description: GoDaddy: Expanding Beyond Domains to Empower Small Businesses While GoDaddy is known for domain names, it has evolved into much more. CEO Blake Irving emphasizes the company’s focus on supporting small businesses, a demographic often overlooked despite representing a significant portion of most economies. Irving highlights that small businesses, even those with a single employee, present a vast untapped market. Traditional solutions often cater to either large enterprises or individual consumers, leaving small businesses underserved.

item.title: Singapore has revealed a budget for 2016 that is favorable to small and medium-sized enterprises
item.description: Source: Budget in Brief document on Singapore Budget website. Singapore’s Finance Minister, Heng Swee Keat, introduced a new program to bolster businesses and industries while stimulating growth through innovation. Building on the Quality Growth Programme from Budget 2013, this initiative, called the Industry Transformation Programme (ITP), seeks to foster innovation and productivity. The goal is to empower Singaporean companies to become more resilient and capitalize on the anticipated global economic upswing.

item.title: Dubai welcomes the opening of a new Chinese Business Hub
item.description: Source: CBH. Pictured at the Business Centre opening ceremony are (from left to right) Justin Wilshaw, SVP Commercial, Dubai South; Shoaib Alrahimi, VP, Business Park, Dubai South; Mohsen Ahmad, VP, Logistics District, Dubai South; alongside other senior officials and association representatives. The UAE’s first dedicated business center specifically designed for new and expanding Chinese startups and SMEs, known as the Chinese Business Hub (CBH), has officially opened its main office in Dubai South Business Park.

item.title: CrowdsUnite offers convenient crowdsourcing updates all in one location
item.description: CrowdsUnite (crowdsunite.com) aims to be the “Yelp” for crowdfunding, featuring over 800 platforms in its database. The website provides guidance on crowdfunding and helps startups find the best platforms for their needs. Alex Feldman, CEO of CrowdsUnite, points out that crowdfunding sites vary in features, customer support, and transparency. He emphasizes the risk of fraudulent campaigns that disappear with investors’ money. Source: CrowdsUnite blog. Feldman presents crowdfunding at a July 2014 talk in New York, US.

item.title: Crowdonomic is now a registered e-facility for equity crowdfunding in Malaysia
item.description: Source: Crowdonomic. Crowdonomic was one of just a few operators approved as a Registered Electronic Facility (Equity Crowdfunding Platform) by Malaysia’s Securities Commission. From left: Nicola Castelnuovo, Co-founder and Chief Commercial Officer of Crowdonomic; Datuk Ranjit Ajit Singh, Chairman, Securities Commission Malaysia and Leo Shimada, Co-Founder and Chief Executive Officer of Crowdonomic. Crowdonomic, a leading crowdfunding platform in Southeast Asia, was designated as a registered electronic facility by the Securities Commission Malaysia (SC).

item.title: Avanta India inaugurates a new office space in Gurgaon
item.description: Avanta Business Centre has established a new premium office space in Gurgaon, India, spanning 25,000 square feet. Conveniently situated near the HUDA City Centre Metro station, the Park Centra facility offers easy accessibility. This marks Avanta’s second business center in Gurgaon. The Park Centra location provides a variety of office sizes, ranging from 77 square feet to approximately 20,000 square feet, to accommodate a diverse clientele. The space is ready for occupancy and features around 300 workstations, a communal area, a pantry, and four meeting rooms.

item.title: TeamAhoy introduces a new project management software that focuses on people
item.description: Source: TeamAhoy. Bramanis. TeamAhoy (previously known as Birds Eye View), an Australian company, has introduced the first public version of its project management software. The startup highlights that its software differentiates itself by prioritizing the human element, unlike competitors. Founder Damian Bramanis explains that while teams consist of people, most project management tools don’t reflect this in their design. He believes TeamAhoy stands out by offering managers a user-friendly platform that centers around individuals.

item.title: Scheduling is made easier with Evie, the AI assistant
item.description: Mimetic.ai, a tech startup, has introduced Evie, an AI-powered scheduling assistant designed to streamline business meeting arrangements. Evie handles communication with participants, finding suitable times for everyone involved. This significantly reduces the usual email ping-pong, saving users time and increasing productivity. Professionals in fields like recruitment, sales, e-commerce, and entrepreneurship are already benefiting from Evie’s assistance. According to mimetic.ai, setting up a single meeting can involve an average of 4.4 emails.
